definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

sentences.english: Blond - haired blue - eyed Westerners also come for a look-see .
sentences.chinese: 金髮碧眼的洋人也來探個究竟。

sentences.english: So Marilyn dyed her brunette hair to a golden blonde.
sentences.chinese: 這樣瑪裏琳把她的黑褐色頭髮染成了金髮碧眼。

sentences.english: She is 28, blonde and quite beautiful.
This blond man delivers newspaper every morning.
sentences.chinese: 這個白膚金髮碧眼的男人每天早晨送報紙。
我喜歡金髮碧眼白皮膚的女郎，你呢？

sentences.english: The man behind you is 285 pounds, and he's blond too.
sentences.chinese: 他們和我一樣也都是白膚金髮碧眼。

sentences.english: She's tall and blond, not short and dark like me.
sentences.chinese: 她個子高，金髮碧眼，不像我又矮又黑。

sentences.english: We were blonde-haired novelties immersed in a foreign culture.
sentences.chinese: 我們這羣金髮碧眼的大學生融入了一個異國文化之中。

sentences.english: He enjoys the company of tall skinny blondes.
sentences.chinese: 他非常喜歡這羣又高又瘦的金髮碧眼的美女。

definition: Pokémon or Pocket Monsters, popular Japanese video game, anime and manga
Okayama prefecture in southwest of Japan's main island Honshū 本州[Ben3 zhou1]
variant of 弗吉尼亞州|弗吉尼亚州/Virginia, US state
Bohemia, historical country of central Europe
to keep up with the latest fashion

pinyin: Gang1 guo3 Min2 zhu3 Gong4 he2 guo2

definition: geisha (Japanese female entertainer)/also written 藝伎|艺伎[yi4 ji4]
